elements.text:
You're working on a report with a few colleagues and need to report some statistics. A colleague suggests that you change the statistics so that your report looks better, but that would be lying.

Here are some feelings that might happen in the moment:

texts: I'll be more confident working on projects in the future knowing that I can interpret real data effectively.
I feel embarrassed about telling my coworkers that this is wrong, but even if they judge me, I will be okay.
I'm nervous about disagreeing with my coworkers, but I know it is the right thing to do
I am upset at my coworkers wanting me to take the easy way out.
I'll feel more proud of our work if I don't change our results.
